intro: Barbarea lyrata, commonly known as the lyrata wintercress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features basal leaves that are kidney-shaped with toothed edges. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in clusters, blooming from late winter to early spring. The species is known for its ability to thrive in rocky and alpine environments, often found in open, sunny habitats.
